item.title: Personal Website 2019
item.description: This previous version of this website. It was a VueJS web app using Firebase as a backend. It had full authentication and CRUD features.

item.title: Connected Car Monitor
item.description: This is a device I designed that used the OBD-II port in a vehicle to gather information like speed and engine RPM. The GPS location is also got from the user’s mobile device via the Blynk app. All of the data is gathered and sent to Firebase (using Adafruit IO as an intermediary for security and data aggregation) where it is stored and where the Vue JS web app is hosted to display the data to the user.

item.title: ASOIF Route Finder
item.description: “Create a route finder for the known world of A Song of Ice and Fire (Game of Thrones) series.” The objective of this team CA exercise is to create an interactive application that can search for and retrieve various routes between specified towns/cities in the “known world” as depicted in George R. R. Martin’s A Song of Ice and Fire book series, which is the basis for the TV series Game of Thrones.

item.title: Game Central
item.description: A website for a local corporate hire business using WordPress. It was running a custom theme that I designed.

item.title: Iris
item.description: A simple device intended to monitor a door or an entrance. When a person is detected by the camera, an alert is sent to the user via Pushbullet. Facial recognition is also run to try and identify the person. All of this information is updated on the Django web app via the Iris API and a still image saved on the device.

item.title: Crazy Carts
item.description: A website for a local event hire business using WordPress.
